member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilter
member.summary: This represents an API entry that is to be removed from the reflection information using MRefBuilder's namespace ripping feature.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilter.EntryType
member.summary: This is used to get or set the API entry type

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilter.FullName
member.summary: This is used to get the fully qualified name of the API entry

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilter.FilterName
member.summary: This is used to get the API filter name
member.value: For API entry types other than namespaces, this is the name without the namespace and, for methods properties, etc. the type.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilter.IsExposed
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not the entry is exposed

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilter.IsProjectExclude
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether or not the entry is excluded via the project (i.e. via the SHFB Namespaces option or an <exclude /> tag.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilter.Children
member.summary: This returns the child API filter collection for this entry
member.value: For namespaces and types, if there are children, they represent the specific entries within the namespace or type to hide or expose.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilter.CompareTo(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilter)
member.summary: Compares this instance to another instance and returns an indication of their relative values
member.returns: Returns -1 if this instance is less than the value, 0 if they are equal, or 1 if this instance is greater than the value or the value is null.
member.remarks: Entries are sorted by API entry type and full name

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilter.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor
member.overloads: There are two overloads for the constructor

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilter.#ctor(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiEntryType,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor. This takes the API type and the full name.
member.param: True to expose it, false to hide it

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilter.ConvertToString(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: This is used to convert the entry and its children to a string ready for use in the MRefBuilder configuration file.
member.param: The string builder to which the information is appended.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilter.FromXml(System.Xml.XmlTextReader)
member.summary: This is used to load the API filter information from the project file
member.param: The XML text reader from which the information is loaded

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilter.ToXml(System.Xml.XmlTextWriter)
member.summary: This is used to save the content item information to the project file
member.param: The XML text writer to which the information is written

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilter.ApiEntryTypeFromLetter(System.Char)
member.summary: This is used to convert an API type letter to an enumerated value.
member.returns: The ApiEntryType represented by the letter

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilterCollection
member.summary: This collection class is used to hold the API filter entries for MRefBuilder to remove

remarks.note: Unlike other collections in the project, this one is cleared and rebuilt if it changes. As such, the contained items do not notify the project when they change as they are created anew each time the collection is rebuilt.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilterCollection.Project
member.summary: This is used to get or set a reference to the project that owns the collection
member.remarks: This is used by collection editors to get a reference to the owning project. Child collections do not contain a reference to the project file.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilterCollection.FromXml(System.String)
member.summary: This is used to load existing API filter items from the project file
member.remarks: The information is stored as an XML fragment

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilterCollection.ToXml
member.summary: This is used to write the API filter info to an XML fragment ready for storing in the project file
member.returns: The XML fragment containing the API filter information

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilterCollection.MergeExclusionEntry(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiEntryType,System.String)
member.summary: This is used to merge an exclusion entry with the filter collection
member.returns: True if merged without conflict or false if the merged member conflicted with an existing entry. The existing entry will take precedence.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilterCollection.AddNamespaceChild(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add a new type entry to this namespace collection
member.param: The full name of the entry
member.returns: True if merged without conflict or false if the merged member conflicted with an existing entry. The existing entry will take precedence.
member.remarks: Entries added by this method are exclusions based on namespace comment or <exclude/> tag exclusions.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilterCollection.AddTypeChild(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add a new member entry to this type collection
member.param: The full name of the entry
member.returns: True if merged without conflict or false if the merged member conflicted with an existing entry. The existing entry will take precedence.
member.remarks: Entries added by this method are exclusions based on namespace comment or <exclude/> tag exclusions.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ApiFilterCollection.ToString
member.summary: Convert the API filter entry and its children to a string
member.returns: The entries in the MRefBuilder API filter XML format

member.name: F:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionBehaviors.Before
member.summary: Execute before the help file builder's normal processing.

member.summary: Execute after the help file builder's normal processing.

member.name: F:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionBehaviors.BeforeAndAfter
member.summary: Execute both before and after the help file builder's normal processing.

member.summary: Execute instead of the help file builder's normal processing. If this flag is set, Before and After are ignored.

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionContext
member.summary: This class defines the execution context in which the plug-in is being called during the build process

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionContext.BuildStep
member.summary: This read-only property returns the current build step

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionContext.Behavior
member.summary: This read-only property returns the execution behavior for the plug-in within the current context
member.value: Before indicates that it is being called before the normal help file builder processing. After indicates that it is being called after the normal help file builder processing. InsteadOf indicates that it is being called instead of the normal help file builder processing.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionContext.Executed
member.summary: This property is used to set or get whether or not the plug-in actually executed
member.value: It is true by default. Set it to false if the plug-in did not execute.

member.summary: Constructor
member.param: The behavior of the plug-in for the current context.
member.exception: This is thrown if an attempt is made to specify more than one behavior type.

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionPoint
member.summary: This class defines when a plug-in gets executed during the build process

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionPoint.BuildStep
member.summary: This read-only property returns the build step in which the plug-in will run.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionPoint.Behavior
member.summary: This read-only property returns the execution behavior of the plug-in.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionPoint.Priority
member.summary: This read-only property returns the execution priority of the plug-in.
member.value: Plug-ins with a higher priority value will execute before those with a lower priority value. If not specified, the default is 1,000.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionPoint.#ctor(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildStep,SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionBehaviors)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: The step in which the plug-in should run.
The behavior of the plug-in when it is ran.
member.exception: This is thrown if an attempt is made to set the Before or After behavior with the InsteadOf behavior. It is also thrown for invalid combinations of build step and behavior, i.e. Initializing with Before or InsteadOf. See the help file for a full list.
member.overloads: There are two overloads for the constructor.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionPoint.#ctor(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildStep,SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionBehaviors,System.Int32)
member.summary: This constructor is used to set a specific execution priority.
member.param: The step in which the plug-in should run.
The behavior of the plug-in when it is ran.
The execution priority for the plug-in.

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess
member.summary: This class is used to handle all aspects of the build process in a separate thread

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess.GenerateApiFilter
member.summary: This is used to generate the API filter collection used by MRefBuilder to exclude items from the reflection information file.
member.remarks: Namespaces and members with an <exclude /> tag in their comments are removed using the ripping feature as it is more efficient than searching for and removing them from the reflection file after it has been generated especially on large projects.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess.MergeComponentConfigurations
member.summary: This is used to merge the component configurations from the project with the sandcastle.config file.

member.summary: This handles merging the build component configurations into the given configuration file
member.param: The configuration file into which the configurations are merged
True for a conceptual configuration file, false for a reference configuration file.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess.MergeComponent(System.String,Sandcastle.Core.BuildAssembler.BuildComponent.BuildComponentFactory,System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.Stack{System.String})
member.summary: This handles merging of the custom component configurations into the configuration file including dependencies.
member.param: The ID of the component to merge
True if this is a conceptual content configuration file or false if it is a reference build configuration file.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess.VerifySafePath(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Make sure the path isn't one the user would regret having nuked without warning
member.param: The name of the path property
The path to the current project
member.remarks:
Since most people don't read the help file and also ignore the warning in the property grid description pane, we'll take some steps to idiot-proof the dangerous path properties. I'm starting to lose count of the number of people that point WorkingPath at the root of their C:\ drive and wonder why all their files disappear.
Paths checked for include root references to hard drives and network shares, most common well-known folders, and the project's root folder.
member.exception: This is thrown if the path is one of the ones that probably should not be used.

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.SubstitutionTagReplacement
member.summary: This class handles substitution tag replacement in build template files

remarks.para: Replacement tags appear in the form of a tag name prefixed with an '@' and enclosed in curly braces ({@PropertyName}). An optional format specifier is also allowed if needed such as for date formatting ({@BuildDate:MMMM d, yyyy}).

Methods in this class tagged with the attribute represent substitution tags that require additional handling. For simple types that require no special handling and those that require only minor changes, the value returned by is used and there is no corresponding method in this class.

member.returns: The transformed text

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.ConceptualContentSettings.CopyContentFiles(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess)
member.summary: This is used to copy the additional content token, image, and topic files to the build folder
member.remarks: This will copy the code snippet file if specified, save token information to a shared content file called _Tokens_.xml in the build process's working folder, copy the image files to the .\media folder in the build process's working folder, save the media map to a file called _MediaContent_.xml in the build process's working folder, and save the topic files to the .\ddueXml folder in the build process's working folder. The topic files will have their content wrapped in a <topic> tag if needed and will be named using their value.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.ConceptualContentSettings.SaveImageSharedContent(System.String,System.String,SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess)
member.summary: Write the image reference collection to a map file ready for use by BuildAssembler
member.param: The file to which the image reference collection is saved
The path to which the image files should be copied
member.remarks: Images with their property set to true are copied to the media folder immediately.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.ConceptualContentSettings.CreateConfigurationFiles(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess)
member.summary: This is used to create the conceptual content build configuration files
member.remarks: This will create the companion files used to resolve conceptual links and the _ContentMetadata_.xml configuration file. It will also merge the conceptual topics into the BuildAssembler manifest file.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.ConceptualContentSettings.CreateCompanionFiles(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess)
member.summary: This is used to create the companion files used to resolve conceptual links

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.ConceptualContentSettings.CreateContentMetadata(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess)
member.summary: Create the content metadata file
member.remarks:
The content metadata file contains metadata information for each topic such as its title, table of contents title, help attributes, and index keywords. Help attributes are a combination of the project-level help attributes and any parsed from the topic file. Any replacement tags in the token values will be replaced with the appropriate project values.
A true MAML version of this file contains several extra attributes. Since Sandcastle doesn't use them, I'm not going to waste time adding them. The only stuff written is what is required by Sandcastle. In addition, I'm putting the title and PBM_FileVersion item elements in here rather than use the separate companion files. They all end up in the metadata section of the topic being built so this saves having two extra components in the configuration that do the same thing with different files.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.ConceptualContent.ConceptualContentSettings.MergeConceptualManifest(SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildProcess)
member.summary: Merge the conceptual topic IDs into the BuildAssembler manifest file.

The base path to remove from files copied from another folder into the project folder. On the first call, this should match the value.
The project to which the files are added

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Design.EscapeValueAttribute
member.summary: This is used to mark a property that needs its value escaped when stored in an MSBuild project file
member.remarks: MSBuild requires that the following characters be escaped in property values unless they are intended to be interpreted by the build engine: % * ? @ $ ( ) ; '. In addition, this attribute will cause the values to be HTML encoded so that any HTML characters, especially tag delimiters are not interpreted. MSBuild tends to add XML namespaces to things it thinks are XML elements.

member.summary: This is used to HTML encode and escape an MSBuild property value
member.returns: The HTML encoded escaped value

member.summary: This is used to return an unescaped and HTML decoded MSBuild value
member.returns: The unescaped and HTML decoded value
member.remarks: MSBuild provides an escape method but no unescape method. Go figure.

member.summary: This is used to convert the match to its unescaped character
member.returns: The unescaped character as a string

member.returns: The integer value

member.remarks: Wildcards are supported in the property.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.DocumentationSource.Configuration
member.summary: This is used to get or set the project configuration to use when the source path refers to a Visual Studio solution or project.
member.value: If not set, the configuration value from the owning help file project will be used. This will be ignored for assembly and XML comments file entries.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.DocumentationSource.Platform
member.summary: This is used to get or set the project platform to use when the source path refers to a Visual Studio solution or project.
member.value: If not set, the platform value from the owning help file project will be used. This will be ignored for assembly and XML comments file entries.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.DocumentationSource.TargetFramework
member.summary: This is used to get or set the project target framework to use when the source path refers to a Visual Studio solution or project.
member.value: This only applies if the project uses multi-targeting. If not set, the first target framework will be used. This will be ignored for assembly and XML comments file entries.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.DocumentationSource.SourceFile
member.summary: This is used to set or get the documentation source file path
member.value: Wildcards are supported. If used, all files matching the wildcard will be included as long as their extension is one of the following: .exe, .dll, .winmd, .*proj, .sln.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.DocumentationSource.IncludeSubFolders
member.summary: This is used to get or set whether subfolders are included when searching for files if the value contains wildcards.
member.value: If set to true and the source file value contains wildcards, subfolders will be included. If set to false, the default, or the source file value does not contain wildcards, only the top-level folder is included in the search.

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath
member.summary: This class is used to represent a file path. Support is included for treating the path as fixed or relative and for expanding environment variables in the path name.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.BasePathProvider
member.summary: This is used to get the base path provider for the object.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.BasePath
member.summary: This returns the base path for the object
member.value: If no has been specified, this returns the current directory

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.Path
member.summary: This is used to get or set the path to use.
member.value:
When set, if the path is not rooted (a relative path), is set to false. If rooted (an absolute path), it is not changed. This property always returns a fully qualified path but without any environment variable expansions.
If set to a null or empty string, the file path is cleared and is considered to be undefined.
member.note: MSBuild environment variable references are also supported (i.e. $(SHFBROOT), $(OutputPath), etc.).

example.code:
Dim path As New FilePath()
' Set it to a relative path path.Path = "..\..\Test.txt"
' Set it to an absolute path path.Path = "C:\My Documents\Info.doc"
' Set it to a path based on an environment variable path.Path = "%HOMEDRIVE%%HOMEPATH%\Favorites\*.*"

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.PersistablePath
member.summary: This is used to retrieve the file path in a format suitable for persisting to storage based on the current settings.
member.remarks: If is true, an absolute path is always returned. If false, the path is returned in a form that is relative to the path stored in the property.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.Exists
member.summary: This read-only property can be used to determine whether or not the file path exists

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.ExpandedPath
member.summary: This read-only property is used to display the fully qualified path with environment variable expansions in the designer.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.IsFixedPath
member.summary: This is used to indicate whether or not the path will be treated as a relative or fixed path when converted retrieved via the property.
member.value: If true, the path is returned as a fixed path when retrieved. If false, it is returned as a path relative to the current value of the property.

member.summary: This event is raised when the persistable path is about to be changed

member.summary: This raises the event

member.summary: This event is raised when the persistable path changes

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.OnPersistablePathChanged(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This raises the event

member.summary: This is used to handle an implicit conversion from a object to a string
member.returns: The file path as a relative or absolute path string based on its current settings

example.code:
Dim filePath As New FilePath("%APPDATA%\TestApp\App.config")
' The FilePath object is automatically converted to a string ' representing the expanded, fully qualified path. Dim pathString As String = filePath

member.summary: Overload for equal operator.
member.returns: True if equal, false if not.

member.summary: Overload for not equal operator.
member.returns: True if not equal, false if they are.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.GetFullPath(System.String)
member.summary: This returns the fully qualified path for the specified path. This version allows wildcards in the filename part if present.
member.returns: The fully qualified path name
member.remarks: The System.IO.Path version of will throw an exception if the path contains wildcard characters. This version does not.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.AbsoluteToRelativePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This helper method can be used to convert an absolute path to one that is relative to the given base path.
member.returns: A path to the given absolute path that is relative to the given base path
member.remarks: If the base path is null or empty, the current working folder is used.

example.code:
Dim basePath As String = "E:\DotNet\CS\TestProject\Source" Dim absolutePath As String = "E:\DotNet\CS\TestProject\Doc\Help.html"
Dim relativePath As String = _ FilePath.AbsoluteToRelativePath(basePath, absolutePath);
Console.WriteLine(relativePath)
' Results in: ..\Doc\Help.html

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FilePath.RelativeToAbsolutePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This helper method can be used to convert a relative path to an absolute path based on the given base path.
member.returns: An absolute path
member.remarks: If the base path is null or empty, the current working folder is used.

example.code:
Dim basePath As String = "E:\DotNet\CS\TestProject\Source" Dim relativePath As String = "..\Doc\Help.html"
Dim absolutePath As String = _ FilePath.RelativeToAbsolutePath(basePath, relativePath);
Console.WriteLine(absolutePath)
' Results in: E:\DotNet\CS\TestProject\Doc\Help.html

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FolderPath
member.summary: This class is used to represent a folder path. Support is included for treating the path as fixed or relative and for expanding environment variables in the path name.

member.name: P:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.FolderPath.Path
member.summary: This is used to get or set the path.
member.value:
When set, if the path is not rooted (a relative path), is set to false. If rooted (an absolute path), it is not changed. This property always returns a fully qualified path but without any environment variable expansions and terminated with a trailing directory separator if needed.
If set to a null or empty string, the folder path is cleared and is considered to be undefined.

example.code:
Dim path As New FolderPath()
' Set it to a relative path path.Path = "..\..\ProjectFolder"
' Set it to an absolute path path.Path = "C:\My Documents\ProjectDocs\"
' Set it to a path based on an environment variable path.Path = "%HOMEDRIVE%%HOMEPATH%\Favorites\"

member.summary: This can be used to ensure that a path is terminated with a trailing directory separator.
member.returns: The path with a trailing directory separator added if necessary.

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.MSBuild.PackageReferenceResolver
member.summary: This is used to resolved package references (PackageReference elements) in MSBuild project files
member.remarks: Package references are handled by the NuGet MSBuild targets. Trying to figure out how they work would be quite difficult as would trying to plug them into the reflection data generation project. However, those tasks create an asset file that contains all of the information we need so we use it to figure out the reference assembly locations along with any dependencies.

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.NamingMethod
member.summary: This public enumerated type defines the naming method to use for the help topic filenames

member.name: F:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.NamingMethod.Guid
member.summary: Use the default GUID file naming method (actually an MD5 hash of the member ID in GUID form).

member.name: F:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.NamingMethod.MemberName
member.summary: Use the member name without parameters as the filename. The characters ":", ".", "#", and "`" in the name are replaced with an underscore (i.e. T:CustomType becomes T_CustomType, M:CustomType.#ctor becomes M_CustomType__ctor, P:CustomType.Property becomes P:CustomType_Property, etc). Duplicate names will have an incrementing value appended to the end of the name (i.e. M_CustomType_Method, M_CustomType.Method_1, M_CustomType_Method_2, etc).

member.name: F:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.NamingMethod.HashedMemberName
member.summary: Use the hashed member name without parameters as the filename. No character replacements are made for this option and the GetHashCode method is used to generate the hash value and it is formatted as a hex value. This is useful for extremely long type names that cause the filename to exceed the maximum length when the full path is included. Duplicate names will have an incrementing value appended to the name prior to creating the hash value as needed.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Load a Sandcastle Builder project from the given filename
member.param: Specify true if the file must exist or false if a new project should be created if the file does not exist.
True to use final evaluated property values, or false to use the unevaluated property values. For builds, this should always be true. If loading the project for editing, it should always be false.
member.exception: This is thrown if a filename is not specified or if it does not exist and mustExist is true.
member.overloads: There are three overloads for the constructor

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.#ctor(Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project)
member.summary: This is used to create a Sandcastle Builder project from an existing MSBuild project instance
member.remarks: It is assumed that the project has been loaded, the property values are current, and that the configuration and platform have been set in the MSBuild project global properties in order to get the correct final values.

member.param: The MSBuild project property to use
The value to which the local property is set
member.remarks: Property name matching is case insensitive as are the values. This is used to allow setting of simple project properties (non-collection) from the MSBuild project file. Unknown properties are ignored.
member.exception: This is thrown if the name parameter is null or an empty string.
This is thrown if an error occurs while trying to set the named property.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.AddFolderToProject(System.String)
member.summary: Add a new folder build item to the project
member.returns: The new .
member.remarks: If the folder does not exist in the project, it is added and created if not already there. If the folder is already part of the project, the existing item is returned.
member.exception: This is thrown if the path matches the project root path or is not below it.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.AddFileToProject(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add a new file build item to the project
member.param: The optional destination path. If empty, null, or it does not start with the project folder, the file is copied to the root folder of the project.
member.returns: The new
member.remarks: If the file does not exist in the project, it is copied to the destination path or project folder if not already there. The default build action is determined based on the filename's extension. If the file is already part of the project, the existing item is returned.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SandcastleProject.ReplacementValueFor(System.String)
member.summary: This is used by the replacement tag handler to get simple project property values that require no other modification or simple ones that can be handled here.
member.param: The property name for which to get the value
member.returns: The property value as a string if found or null if not found. If the property name starts with "HtmlEnc", the return value is HTML encoded. Boolean values and those ending with "SdkLinkType" are converted to lowercase for use in XML attribute values.

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SdkLinkTarget
member.summary: This public enumerated type defines the locations in which a browser window can be opened for the external website links.

member.name: F:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SdkLinkTarget.Blank
member.summary: The URL is loaded into a new unnamed window.

member.name: F:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SdkLinkTarget.Self
member.summary: The current document is replaced with the specified URL.

member.name: F:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.SdkLinkTarget.Parent
member.summary: The URL is loaded into the current frame's parent. If the frame has no parent, this value acts like the value Self.

member.name: T:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Utility
member.summary: This class contains utility and extension methods

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Utility.RunsAt(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionPoint},SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildStep,SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionBehaviors)
member.summary: This is used to determine if the enumerable list of execution points contains an entry for the specified build step and behavior.
member.param: An enumerable list of execution points to check
member.returns: True if the enumerable list of execution points contains an entry for the specified build step and behavior or false if it does not.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Utility.PriorityFor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionPoint},SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildEngine.BuildStep,SandcastleBuilder.Utils.BuildComponent.ExecutionBehaviors)
member.summary: This is used to obtain the execution priority for a plug-in within the given build step and behavior
member.param: An enumerable list of execution points to search
member.returns: The execution priority is used to determine the order in which the plug-ins will be executed. Those with a higher priority value will be executed before those with a lower value. Those with an identical priority may be executed in any order within their group.

member.name: M:SandcastleBuilder.Utils.Utility.ReadWithEncoding(System.String,System.Text.Encoding@)
member.summary: This is used to read in a file using an appropriate encoding method
member.param: Pass the default encoding to use. On return, it contains the actual encoding for the file.
member.returns: The contents of the file
member.remarks: When reading the file, it uses the default encoding specified but detects the encoding if byte order marks are present. In addition, if the template is an XML file and it contains an encoding identifier in the XML tag, the file is read using that encoding.
